page.title: 04HOUSING IN THE VALE
page.content: At this eastern end of the Vale of Glamorgan there is a scattered farming community with separate isolated dwellings. There are clusters of old houses and cottages at St Lythan, St Lythans Down and Dyffryn. There is a small group of council houses just south of St Nicholas. At Wallston, on the Western edge of Wenvoe village there are modern detached houses occupied mainly by people who commute to Cardiff for employment. All inhabitants have to go outside the area for amenities, such as schools, shops, libraries, health centres etc. At Dyffryn there are two buildings of particular interest, a large private house which retains a moat, and a beautiful thatched cottage typical of many such dwellings in the Vale.
